item.description: Setting this to Yes causes the OverlayHD Skin Manager plugin, if active, to also be listed in the Extensions menu.
Setting this to Yes causes the themes in the OverlayHD Theme Manager list to be sorted by the theme name.

Setting this to Yes causes the OverlayHD Skin Manager plugin to group selected settings into blocks that can be hidden or displayed as required. Setting this to No makes the plugin display all options as one long list.
Setting this to Yes causes the configuration options for general settings to be displayed.
Setting this to Yes causes the configuration options for menus to be displayed.
Setting this to Yes causes the configuration options for text messages to be displayed.
Setting this to Yes causes the configuration options for the Info screens to be displayed.
Setting this to Yes causes the configuration options for the FAV service selection screens to be displayed.
Setting this to Yes causes the configuration options for the EPG screens to be displayed.

item.text: Show panel and plugin color settings
item.description: Setting this to Yes causes the configuration options for panels and plugins to be displayed.
Setting this to Yes causes the configuration options for font selection to be displayed.
Choose a background image to be used while the system boots.
Choose a background image to be used while the system UI starts.
Choose a background image to be used while listening to radio services.
Choose a spinner animation for the system busy spinner.
Choose a button style for the color button bar.
Choose a color for the RED button.
Choose a color for the GREEN button.
Choose a color for the YELLOW button.
Choose a color for the BLUE button.
Choose a color for the color button text.
Choose a color for the color button background.
Choose the level of screen saver screen background transparency.
Setting this to Yes forces all the color buttons to be displayed even if they don't currently have a purpose.
Choose when and where scroll bars are shown in all list boxes.
Choose how all list boxes will scroll. With 'Page mode' the cursor will jump to the previous/next screen. With 'Line mode' the previous/next line will be scrolled into view.
Choose when and where scroll bars are shown in all ScrollLabels.
Choose how all ScrollLabels will scroll. With 'Page mode' the cursor will jump to the previous/next screen. With 'Line mode' the previous/next line will be scrolled into view.
Enable to display the REC icon blinking.
Enable to display the firmware update available icon blinking.

item.text: Show EPG time line tick marks
item.description: Setting this to Yes causes the time line tick marks to be displayed.
